bill_title: conduct a study on the feasibility of maintaining aircraft under the control of the Department of Transportation.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to conduct a study on the feasibility of maintaining aircraft under the control of the Department of Transportation. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Department of Transportation shall conduct a study on the need for and the feasibility of maintaining aircraft under its control for the State of South Dakota. The study shall include a comparison between costs calculated in section 2 of this Act and estimated costs of obtaining the same transportation service from commercial aircraft or chartered aircraft. Section 2. The study provided for in section 1 of this Act shall include the estimated annual costs of maintaining and flying aircraft under the control of the Department of Transportation including maintenance and repair, pilot salaries, mechanic salaries, hangar space, and any other cost items associated with maintaining and flying these aircraft. Section 3. The Department of Transportation shall provide a written report on the study provided for in section 1 of this Act to the Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council not later than November 1, 2011. 135 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.075 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
